articles.title: Kāpiti man prepares for his own death as euthanasia law begins - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: Steve Smith could be one of the first New Zealanders to make use of a new law, allowing the terminally ill to end their own lives.
articles.content:
Steve Smith will have a last conversation with his wife then die at a preset time in her arms.
 "For me, it is a tiredness-of-life choice because of pain but also because I have no quality of life a… [+4027 chars]

articles.title: Sabre-toothed cats cared for each other when injured, fossil evidence suggests - CBC.ca
articles.description: Researchers identified bone damage suggesting a cat lived a long life with hip dysplasia, which means it likely only could have survived with help from other animals.
